content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = [string(year, month) for (year, month) in Iterators.zip(
        df[:dt] .|> DateTimes.year,
        df[:dt] .|> DateTimes.month,
    )]
    return df
end
```
This function assumes that the `DataFrame` `df` has a column named `dt` containing `DateTimes` and it extracts the year and month from each element in the `dt` column using the `year` and `month` accessors of the `DateTime` type. It then concatenates them together as an integer in the format "yyyymm" before appending this new column to the `DataFrame` as `ym`. Finally, it returns the updated `DataFrame` with the new column.
